column4: How can I force a certain Mode/ModeLine to be used when starting X?
In particular, X is choosing 1600x1200, which is invalid for my monitor.
if you set an xorg.conf you can set the leftmost value in xorg.conf
I am trying to write an xorg.conf file because my monitor has a bad EDID (apparently).
yes, you will define resolutions in xorg.conf, the leftmost is the default. alternatively you can set an xrandr command to set the res at logon
I will paste my current xorg.conf...
the modes in the display section
in the subsections in the screen section you define modes there too
I created the xorg.conf file by doing: Xorg :1 -configure
obviously change the resolutions to ones you want to use
